author: pestilence2960
content: Not entirely sure which channel this question would best to ask this, but a quick one: is 30311 used by anything eth-related? Suddenly getting a lot of (blocked) connections here on my staking machine that I don't recall seeing before.

author: protolambda
content: I don't recognize the port, but it looks similar to 30303 which is used by eth1 nodes for TCP (regular p2p traffic) and UDP (discovery). And 30301 is used by some discv4 discovery bootnodes iirc. I think they recently enabled discv5 in Geth, sharing the discovery layer with Eth2, maybe that's what you're seeing. Just guessing though, not enough context. Maybe <@194432762315407360> knows
